Culture.name: {=gondorfaction}Gondorian
Culture.text: {=gondorfactiondesc}The people of Gondor are a proud and resilient folk, heirs to the greatest kingdom of Men in Middle-earth. Established by the Númenórean exiles, Gondor stands as a bastion of strength and hope against the encroaching darkness of Mordor. Its stone cities, crowned by the majestic Minas Tirith, are marvels of engineering and endurance, reflecting the legacy of a bygone age. Gondor’s people are defined by their unwavering sense of duty and a fierce loyalty to their land and lineage. Guided by noble stewards and valiant captains, they field disciplined armies, with shield walls of steadfast infantry and the swift lances of mounted knights. Though beset by internal strife and the relentless shadow of Sauron, Gondor remains unyielding, a shining beacon of defiance and hope in the face of despair.

Culture.name: {=PjO7oY16}Dwarves
Culture.text: {=erebor_faction_desc}The Longbeards of Erebor are a proud and industrious race, dwelling in the halls of the Lonely Mountain. Masters of craftsmanship and mining, they are renowned for their skill in forging weapons, armor, and treasures of unrivaled beauty. Led by their King under the Mountain, the dwarves of Erebor are a resilient people, fiercely protective of their homeland and its riches. Though their numbers have dwindled, their unyielding courage and indomitable spirit make them a force to be reckoned with, whether defending their mountain stronghold or seeking vengeance against their foes.

Culture.name: {=mordorfaction}Mordor
Culture.text: {=mordorfactiondesc}The realm of Mordor, forged by the Dark Lord Sauron, is a land of dread and malice, its blackened plains and jagged peaks echoing the will of its master. Enclosed by the ashen teeth of the Ephel Dúath and the fiery forges of Mount Doom, Mordor is a bastion of fear and domination. Its armies are vast and relentless, composed of ruthless Orcs, formidable Uruk-hai, and enslaved Men from the East and South. Guided by the iron fist of Sauron and his Nazgûl lieutenants, Mordor is an unyielding force of shadow and death. Its fortresses, from the obsidian towers of Barad-dûr to the haunted ruins of Minas Morgul, are grim symbols of its master's unrelenting pursuit of power. Mordor’s strength lies in its overwhelming numbers, unbridled savagery, and the terror it spreads, an unrelenting tide threatening to engulf all of Middle-earth in darkness.

Culture.name: {=rivendellfaction}Ñoldor Elves
Culture.text: {=rivendell_faction_desc}Nestled within the serene valley of Imladris, Rivendell stands as a bastion of wisdom, beauty, and ancient heritage. Founded by Elrond Half-elven, it is a haven for those who seek refuge from the growing darkness of Middle-earth. Here, the Elves of Rivendell preserve the knowledge, art, and lore of ages past, blending grace with unmatched skill in both craftsmanship and battle. Their warriors are swift and precise, their leaders wise and noble. Known for their reverence of nature and unity with the world around them, Rivendell remains a sanctuary where hope endures amidst the encroaching shadow.

Culture.name: {=mirkwoodfaction}Silvan Elves
Culture.text: {=mirkwood_faction_desc}The vast and shadowed expanse of Mirkwood, once known as Greenwood the Great, stands as a realm of mystery and danger. The Silvan Elves of Mirkwood, led by King Thranduil, dwell within the northern reaches of the forest, guarding their halls and the fading beauty of their woodland realm. Renowned for their keen archery, stealth, and mastery of the forest, these elves are fiercely protective of their home. Mirkwood's dense canopy and shadowy depths harbor both beauty and peril, with ancient trees whispering of a time before the encroachment of shadow. Despite the growing threat of Dol Guldur, the Silvan Elves endure, balancing their isolationist tendencies with an undying resolve to protect their lands.

Culture.name: {=lothlorienfaction}Galadhrim Elves
Culture.text: {=lothlorien_faction_desc}Lothlórien, the Golden Wood, stands as a beacon of beauty and mystery amidst the growing shadow in Middle-earth. Guarded by the wise and powerful Lady Galadriel and her consort Lord Celeborn, this sanctuary of the Elves is known for its timeless grace and ethereal tranquility. Its inhabitants, the Galadhrim, are a noble and valiant people, skilled in archery and the arts of stealth. Lothlórien’s golden mallorn trees and shimmering rivers reflect an age long past, a vision of elven splendor untouched by the corruption of the world. Though their time in Middle-earth wanes, the Galadhrim remain vigilant, defending their sacred home against any who would threaten its serenity.

Culture.name: {=PjO7oY16}Umbar
Culture.text: {=umbar_faction_desc}The people of Umbar are seafaring warriors and corsairs, masters of the seas south of Gondor. Descended from Númenórean exiles, they are known for their cunning and ferocity in battle. Under black sails, their fleets raid the coasts, striking fear into the hearts of their enemies. While their allegiances lie with Sauron, the Corsairs of Umbar are fiercely independent, valuing strength and cunning above all. Their culture is a mix of maritime tradition and ruthless pragmatism, producing warriors who excel in naval combat and plundering. Umbar's harbors are filled with swift ships and its streets echo with the tales of legendary pirates and sea captains.

Culture.name: {=PjO7oY16}Isengard
Culture.text: {=isengard_faction_desc}The people of Isengard are Saruman’s legions, forged through industry and fueled by a dark vision of domination. Centered around the impenetrable tower of Orthanc, Isengard is home to the Uruk-hai, bred for strength, endurance, and obedience. With machines of war and the cunning of their master, they crush all opposition with ruthless precision. Saruman's army is a mix of savage Dunlendings, disciplined Uruk-hai, and mindless thralls. The forges of Isengard never rest, spewing forth weapons, armor, and engines of destruction. This is a realm driven by ambition, treachery, and an unwavering hunger for power.

Culture.name: {=gundabadname}Gundabad Orcs
Culture.text: {=gundabad_faction_desc}The denizens of Gundabad are the Orcs of the Misty Mountains, savage and relentless. From the ancient stronghold of Mount Gundabad, they raid the surrounding lands, driven by a thirst for vengeance and conquest. Under the rule of powerful chieftains, they amass legions of goblins, wargs, and trolls. Gundabad's warriors are brutish and cunning, masters of ambush and overwhelming force. Their dark halls echo with the forges of crude weaponry, and their banners are symbols of fear to all who face them.

Culture.name: {=dolguldurname}Dol Guldur Orcs
Culture.text: {=dolguldur_faction_desc}Dol Guldur is a fortress of shadow and malice. Once a stronghold of Sauron in Mirkwood, it is now ruled by the Necromancer’s dark lieutenants. The armies of Dol Guldur are a fearsome blend of orcs, wargs, and dark sorcery. This bastion of evil corrupts the forest around it, spreading decay and despair. The warriors of Dol Guldur are relentless, driven by the will of their dark master to crush all who oppose them.

Culture.name: {=empirefaction}Dunlendings
Culture.text: {=dunlending_faction_desc}The Dunlendings are a rugged and fierce people, dwelling in the wild hills and untamed lands west of Rohan. Long resentful of the Rohirrim, whom they see as invaders of their ancestral homes, the Dunlendings are united by their shared heritage and fierce independence. Skilled in guerrilla warfare and survival, they rely on cunning and ferocity to overcome their enemies. Though often dismissed as simple hill folk, the Dunlendings are a proud and enduring people, fiercely protective of their lands and ways of life. Driven by a deep-seated grudge against Rohan, they have allied themselves with the forces of darkness, seeking revenge and the restoration of their lost lands.

Culture.name: {=aseraifaction}Haradrim
Culture.text: {=haradrim_faction_desc}The Haradrim are a proud and fierce people hailing from the deserts and savannahs of the distant south. Renowned for their mastery of exotic beasts such as mûmakil, their warriors combine skill, resilience, and deadly precision in battle. Harad is a land of extremes, with its scorching sun, golden sands, and vibrant oases. Its people are united by ancient traditions, loyalty to their tribes, and the call of their chieftains and kings. Often allied with the forces of darkness, the Haradrim are driven by vengeance against Gondor and the promise of power and dominion offered by Sauron.

Culture.name: {=PjO7oY16}Bardings
Culture.text: {=bardings_faction_desc}The Bardings of Dale, named for Bard the Bowman, are a proud and industrious people who rose to prominence after reclaiming their homeland from the shadow of Smaug. Nestled between the Lonely Mountain and the Long Lake, Dale thrives as a hub of trade and culture. Known for their resilience and craftsmanship, the Bardings excel in forging weapons and armor, rivaling even the Dwarves of Erebor. Their armies, composed of disciplined archers, stalwart swordsmen, and agile skirmishers, defend their lands with fierce determination. United under noble leaders, the Bardings are ever watchful, guarding against the encroaching darkness and preserving their rich heritage.

Culture.name: {=FjwRsf1C}Rohirrim
Culture.text: {=rohirrim_faction_desc}The Rohirrim, or Horse-lords of Rohan, are renowned for their unmatched cavalry and deep bond with their steeds. Proud and free-spirited, they dwell in the rolling plains of the Riddermark, living in villages and strongholds like Edoras. Guided by their King and loyal to their people, the Rohirrim prize honor, loyalty, and courage. Their warriors ride fearlessly into battle, forming the backbone of Middle-earth’s resistance against the shadow. Though steadfast in their traditions, the Rohirrim are ever ready to defend their land and allies, wielding spears, swords, and shields with precision.

Culture.name: {=0B27RrYJ}Variags
Culture.text: {=variags_faction_desc}The Variags of Khand are a fierce and warlike people, hailing from the dry and rugged lands east of Mordor. Known for their mercenary prowess and loyalty to Sauron, the Variags fight with unmatched ferocity. They ride swift warhorses into battle, wielding curved blades and long spears with deadly precision. Their bronze and crimson armor, adorned with intricate designs, reflects their proud and martial heritage. Divided into tribes and clans, the Variags unite under powerful warlords, bringing fear and chaos to the enemies of the Dark Lord.

Culture.name: {=sZLd6VHi}Easterlings
Culture.text: {=easterlings_faction_desc}The Easterlings are a diverse and fearsome people from the distant lands of Rhûn. Known for their loyalty to Sauron, they march to war with precision and discipline, wielding curved blades, spears, and massive war-drums that echo across the battlefield. Their golden armor and crimson banners reflect their fierce pride and martial prowess. Divided into clans and tribes, the Easterlings unite under powerful chieftains to bring the might of Rhûn against the Free Peoples of Middle-earth.
